Home About Portfolio

Projects

2D Graphics

The aim for this module was to use basic 2D graphic techniques to create a 2D scene and use 2D physics to help animate / simulate the scene.

3D Graphics Part 1

The aim for this coursework was to build a 3D scene using basic graphics techniques in OpenGL.

3D Graphics Part 2

The aim for this coursework is to create GLSL shader effects in the software RenderMonkey.

Games Architecture

Using Entity-Component-System architecture, implement a game engine. Then use the game engine to build a 3D pacman game.

Global Game Jam - 2020

Global Game Jam is an annual event that is run around the globe, with schools and universities hosting it at various locations. The event lasts over the weekend, with the aim for teams of students to build a game based around a theme. This year the theme was ‘Repair’.

Honours Stage Project

Real Time Graphics

Physics Simulation

The aim for this coursework was to build a simple physics engine that would simulate balls, or other shapes falling down a box with different impeding layers contained within.

Three Thing Game - Nov 2018

Three Thing Game is a biannual event that is run at the University of Hull. The event lasts over the weekend, with the aim for teams of students to build a game based on three given words. My team was given the words “Learning”, “Inventor” and “Walking”.
